body: THERE is a parking lot at Nevins Street and Atlantic Avenue in Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, that is plain and small and a testament to the vagaries of the human mind. title: URBAN STUDIES/ECHOING; Her City by the Bay, Almost

title: Williamsburg Journal; A Free Ride For Women, By Women, Late at Night

title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BOERUM HILL; Something Big in the Backyard Grows

body: BUZZY O'KEEFE'S foie gras vendors thought he was nuts when he opened the tony River Cafe in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge in 1977. ''Everybody in New York said I was out of my mind, that nobody would come to Brooklyn,'' he said. ''When I first opened up,'' he added, ''they were afraid.'' That was then. Now that once-grotty waterfront parcel is
title: LIVING IN/Brooklyn Heights; A Graceful Bastion in a Swirling Borough

title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BOERUM HILL; A Rescuer Of Animals Draws Some Yelps

body: Even crouched on the roof of her brownstone with a dripping paintbrush in her hand, Genevieve Christy retains much of the Southern gentility of her New Orleans upbringing. title: Man Dies After Being Set Ablaze in Brooklyn

body: By most measures, it was a spectacular Fourth of July in New York City, with balmy breezes, festive crowds and a vast display of pyrotechnics over the East River. title: Fireworks Pop, And So Do Complaints Of the Irritated

body: IT was 1:30 in the afternoon as the lanky man in the dusty blue postal uniform removed the first rubber band from the bunches of mail that filled his three-wheeled United States Postal Service delivery cart to overflowing. body: IT'S not that Garrett Oliver doesn't like wine. In fact, he knows more about it than most people, enjoys it often with food, even sings its praises. title: When the Right Wine Is a Beer
